alternative_parents.description: Benzoic acids  in which the hydrogen atom at position 3 of the benzene ring is replaced by a methoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: M-methoxybenzoic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing or derived from 1-phenylpropan-2-amine.
alternative_parents.name: Amphetamines and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds containing a monocyclic benzene moiety carrying exactly two methoxy groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dimethoxybenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a phenylpropane moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Phenylpropanes

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a methoxybenzene or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Anisoles

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an acyl moiety of benzoic acid with the formula (C6H5CO-).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoyl derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl aryl ether functional group with the generic formula R-O-R' , where R is an alkyl group and R' is an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl aryl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), and a side-chain that is specific to each amino acid.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives in which the carbon atom from the carbonyl group is attached to an alkyl or an aryl moiety through an oxygen atom (forming an ester group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as p-methoxybenzoic acids and derivatives. These are benzoic acids in which the hydrogen atom at position 4 of the benzene ring is replaced by a methoxy group.

direct_parent.description: Benzoic acids in which the hydrogen atom at position 4 of the benzene ring is replaced by a methoxy group.
direct_parent.name: P-methoxybenzoic acids and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Benzoic acids in which a hydrogen atom of the benzene ring is replaced by a methoxy group.
intermediate_nodes.name: Methoxybenzoic acids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxylic acid substituent attached to a benzene ring.
subclass.name: Benzoic acids and derivatives

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
